byline.original: By NICHOLAS CASEY and MAGGY AYALA
byline.contributor: Nicholas Casey reported from El Matal, and Maggy Ayala from Portoviejo, Ecuador.

lead_paragraph: New York Times journalists accompanied an aid mission to a devastated area without water, power or the means to contact the outside world.

headline.print_headline: In Remote Ecuador Towns Hit by Quake, Days Passed Before Help Arrived
headline.main: In Remote Ecuador Towns Hit by Quake, Contact Was Cut Off for Days

snippet: New York Times journalists accompanied an aid mission to a devastated area without water, power or the means to contact the outside world.
abstract: Days passed before rescue workers reached Ecuadorian village of El Matal following 7.8 magnitude earthquake that obliterated roads and communication lines and severed area from civilization; quake killed over 500 people in region, with roughly 1,700 still missing.
